prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would. In any month with five Mondays, a school declares the fifth Monday a Marvelous Monday. School begins on Monday, September 4. What is the date of the first Marvelous Monday after school starts? (If you abbreviate, do not use a dot in the abbreviation.)
solution:
September has 30 days.  September 4 is a Monday, so September 9 is a Saturday.  Since September 30 is exactly 21 days later (or 3 weeks), September 30 is also a Saturday.

Then October 1 is a Sunday, and October 2 is a Monday.  Then October 2, 9, 16, 23, and 30 are all Mondays, so the first Marvelous Monday is $\boxed{\text{October 30}}$.
gpt_response: Let's count the Mondays after September 4. We have: September 4, 11, 18, 25, and October 2. The fifth Monday will be on October 30. So, the first Marvelous Monday after school starts is on October 30.
solution_prompt: Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to \text{October 30?: Let's count the Mondays after September 4. We have: September 4, 11, 18, 25, and October 2. The fifth Monday will be on October 30. So, the first Marvelous Monday after school starts is on October 30.
